body_content.explanation: a thick type of soy sauce (= a strong-tasting, dark brown liquid made from fermented soya beans and used especially in Chinese and Japanese cooking):
examples: Variations on basic soy sauce include tamari - a Japanese version that is thicker, darker, and more mellow than traditional soy sauce.
Use tamari sauce if you are wheat sensitive.
Add in some shrimp, green curry paste and tamari soy sauce.
